translation: "Om saravatha nyurveda [(sarawon+(l-i))/wood] ti saparahoga anon yanshasahā (seven times), then praise the Buddha, saying.

source_sentence: 摩賀(引)迦(引)抳嚕(引)建曩(引)貪(一)捨娑跢(二合引)藍薩嚩吠(得微閉反引)儞(泥以反)南(二合)奔(浦閟反去)女(鼻音)娜地蠅(二合)[雨/婁]拏(引)馱藍(三)鉢羅(二合)拏(上)摩(引)弭怛他(引)誐眈(四佛)唵羅儗野(二合)惹(引)曩南(引)秫(詩佛反)淡(一)戍婆(引)訥[(薩-文+(立-一))/木]底(丁以反)謨(引)左釰(二本)播(引)羅沫體(他以反)迦謎(引)建躭(三)曩謎(引)達[牟*含]舍麼嚩憾(四法)穆訖躭(二合)穆訖底(二合)播(引)他(引)鉢羅(二合)跛躭(二合引)誐乞灑(二合)野索(引)弭野(二)嚩(引)沙體(二合)躭乞灑(二合)怛覽(二合)尾始瑟鵂[雨/婁](上)拏刎(無本反一)曩謎(引)僧(去)健左婆(引)嚩(上)跢(都各反四僧)薩嚩母馱婆羅(二合)捨跢(二合引)野三勃哩(二合)跢(引)野[雨/婁]隸[雨/婁]覽(二)阿嚩路(引)枳多僧(去)枳孃(二合)野(三)曩謨(引)[寧*頁]髻摩賀答摩(二合)儞(四菩薩)摩賀(引)摩攞(勤可反)野贊拏野(上)尾儞野(二合)羅惹(日羅反)野娑(引)馱吠(引准反二)訥難(上)多娜摩迦夜(引三)曩謨(引)悉帝嚩日羅(二合)播(引)拏(上)曳(引去四金剛眾)阿(引)演(引)覩泥嚩左誐素羅(一)緊那(上)羅那囉鑠迦羅(二合)那野(二)鉢羅(二合)嚩羅(二合)達麼蘖里(二合)多地伽羅(三)尾達麼左鉢羅(二合)捨麼操爾也(二合四)儞銘(二合)多部多銘多鉢羅(二合)迦捨夜(五)怛儞賀室羅(二合)摩拏也馱(引)[牟*含](引六二合諸天)次發願。

Next, he scatters his recitations.
First, he pays homage to the Three Treasures.
Next, he pays homage to the original honored one.
Then, he pays universal homage to the buddhas.
The next person who recites the vow first sits cross-legged.

source_sentence: 捺婆等座謂跏趺半跏賢麻座。
translation: A lotus seat is a lotus position that's cross-legged and half-lotus positioned on a hemp seat.
He makes himself upright.
Next, he takes several beads.
He turns it three times to the right.

source_sentence: 次安珠二掌中頂戴(云云)次結根本印。
translation: Next, place the beads in the top of the two palms and carry them (clouds). Next, he forms the fundamental seal.
He recites the basic dhāraṇī (seven times).
Next, he recites it.
He then puts the beads on his head.
He gives rise to the vow to place it in its original place.
Next, he sets the fundamental seal.
He recites the fundamental true saying (seven times).

source_sentence: 次更奉塗香華燒香飯燈。
translation: Next, he offers a scented flower, burns incense, and serves a meal.
Next, he makes offerings with his mind.
Next, he praises it.
Next, he offers incense and flowers, burns a scented rice lamp, and makes offerings with his mind.
Next, he gives rise to the vow.
Next, he unlocks the bounds.
Next, he shows him the concentration.
He then venerates the venerables.
Next, he recites the verses of the tathāgatas in their present form.
Next, he presents the true words.
Next, he returns the nine skillful means.
Next, he dedicates his merits.
Next, he recites the three divisions of the samaya.
"Next, he protects himself.
Next, he protects the original venerable and so forth.
Next, he pays full homage to the venerables.
Then he departs.
He takes refuge in the hall of the Buddha's abode.
He practices the sutra as he wishes.

source_sentence: 小指檀慧(上左下右)無名指戒方(上左下右)中指忍願(上右下左)頭指進力(上左下右)大指禪智(上左下右)。
translation: His little finger is tantra wisdom (top left, bottom right), his ring finger is precepts direction (top left, bottom right), his middle finger is vows of forbearance (top right, bottom left), his head finger is power of effort (top left, bottom right), and his big finger is meditation wisdom (top left, bottom right).
"Venerable Sunna.
"Venerable Sunnah.
It's because of the power of his original vow.
He's come to subdue them.
He's been given the vehicle's blessing.
He grants this invitation.
He'll also accept the offerings I've made.
Arise from great compassion.
Please accept them.

source_sentence: 現在諸如來　　救世諸菩薩
translation: Present tathāgatas, world-saving bodhisattvas...

source_sentence: 不斷大乘教　　到殊勝位者
translation: one who does not cut off the teachings of the great vehicle and reaches a superior position

source_sentence: 唯願聖天眾　　決定證知我
translation: may the holy celestials all definitely realize the self

source_sentence: 各當隨處安　　後時垂哀赴
translation: Each should take his place, and then extend his condolences.
Final chant.

source_sentence: 我今念誦祕密呪　　普通三界得清淨　願我生中除業障　　福德圓滿利有情　生生世世恒受持　　四恩眾生共成佛藥師儀軌一具(終　傳教大師將來)
translation: "Now, I recite this secret dhāraṇī, which will purify the three realms in common. May I remove the karmic hindrances in my lifetime, perfect my virtue for the benefit of sentient beings, and always maintain it for generations to come. One Medicine Master Ritual Procedure for Sentient Beings Who Share the Buddhahood of the Four Gracious Ones (end).
